snippet: A bronze disk recently discovered in the mud near London's Putney Bridge turns out to be a first-century Roman brothel token, and one of the earliest examples of British pornographic art.
abstract: A bronze disk recently discovered in the mud near London's Putney Bridge turns out to be a first-century Roman brothel token, and one of the earliest examples of British pornographic art.
lead_paragraph: A bronze disk recently discovered in the mud near the Putney Bridge in London seemed innocent enough, but on close inspection it has turned out to be one of the oldest pieces of British pornographic art, according to the Guardian.

headline.main: Ancient Pornographic Artifact Discovered by the Thames
